clusters.title: 'The Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region'
clusters.neutral_headline: Nigerian Schoolchildren Escape Kidnapping, Others Still Missing

items.title: 'The Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region'
items.standfirst: Fifty of the more han 300 students kidnapped from a Nigerian Catholic school last week have escaped and have been reunited with their parents, the Catholic Church and Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said on Sunday. While waiting for more information, the Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region.
items.content: Fifty of the more han 300 students kidnapped from a Nigerian Catholic school last week have escaped and have been reunited with their parents, the Catholic Church and Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said on Sunday. While waiting for more information, the Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region.

items.title: Pope calls on kidnappers to free 265 Nigerian students and teachers after 50 pupils escape
items.standfirst: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in north-central Nigeria’s Niger state have escaped captivity and are now with their families, the school authority said Sunday, as the pope called for the immediate release of those still missing.
items.content: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in north-central Nigeria’s Niger state have escaped captivity and are now with their families, the school authority said Sunday, as the pope called for the immediate release of those still missing.

items.title: 50 of 303 abducted Nigerian students escape captivity; others still missing
items.standfirst: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.
items.content: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.

items.title: Fifty schoolchildren escape kidnappers in Nigeria, more than 250 remain captive
items.standfirst: Fifty of the more than 300 children kidnapped by gunmen from a Catholic school in Niger state managed to escape their captors and have reunited with their families, a Christian group affiliated with the school said on Sunday. Armed attackers on Friday took 303 children and 12 teachers captive in one of Nigeria's largest mass kidnappings to date.
items.content: Fifty of the more than 300 children kidnapped by gunmen from a Catholic school in Niger state managed to escape their captors and have reunited with their families, a Christian group affiliated with the school said on Sunday. Armed attackers on Friday took 303 children and 12 teachers captive in one of Nigeria's largest mass kidnappings to date.

items.title: Christian group in Nigeria says 50 students abducted by gunmen have escaped
items.standfirst: Authorities look for missing students and teachers after two major incidents of kidnappings take place within days.
items.content: Authorities look for missing students and teachers after two major incidents of kidnappings take place within days.

items.title: 50 schoolchildren escape captivity in Nigeria, more than 200 still held
items.standfirst: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.
items.content: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.(Image credit: Sunday Alamba)

items.title: Dozens of kidnapped schoolchildren escape as Pope Leo appeals for release of remaining abductees
items.standfirst: At least 50 of the 303 children abducted this week from a Catholic school in Nigeria have escaped and been reunited with their families, a church group has said, as Pope Leo pleaded for their immediate release.
items.content: At least 50 of the 303 children abducted this week from a Catholic school in Nigeria have escaped and been reunited with their families, a church group has said, as Pope Leo pleaded for their immediate release.

items.title: Security fears rise in Nigeria after more than 300 schoolchildren kidnapped
items.standfirst: Christian group revises up number of students and teachers missing after one of country’s largest mass abductionGunmen have kidnapped more than 300 students and teachers in one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria, a Christian group said on Saturday, as security fears mounted in Africa’s most populous nation.The early Friday raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger state in western Nigeria came after gunmen on Monday stormed a secondary school in neighbouring Kebbi state, abducting 25 girls. Continue reading...
items.content: Christian group revises up number of students and teachers missing after one of country’s largest mass abductionGunmen have kidnapped more than 300 students and teachers in one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria, a Christian group said on Saturday, as security fears mounted in Africa’s most populous nation.The early Friday raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger state in western Nigeria came after gunmen on Monday stormed a secondary school in neighbouring Kebbi state, abducting 25 girls. Continue reading...

items.title: Nigeria reels after 215 children taken in second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...
items.content: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Gunmen kidnapped over 300 students and teachers from a Catholic school in Nigeria.
Fifty of the abducted schoolchildren escaped and reunited with their families.
The Nigerian government decided to close all schools in the affected region.
Pope Francis called for the release of the remaining kidnapped individuals.
This incident is one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria to date.

clusters.title: Hezbollah chief of staff killed in Beirut airstrike, Israeli military says
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel Kills Top Hezbollah Official in Beirut Airstrike

items.title: Hezbollah chief of staff killed in Beirut airstrike, Israeli military says
items.standfirst: Militant group confirms Haytham Ali Tabatabai was killed in attack that dramatically escalates tensions in the regionIsrael targeted one of Hezbollah’s most senior military commanders in an airstrike in Beirut’s southern suburbs on Sunday, dramatically escalating tensions with the group almost exactly a year after a ceasefire ended 14 months of clashes.The Israeli military said several hours after the attack that Haytham Ali Tabatabai, Hezbollah’s chief of staff, was killed in the strike in Lebanese capital. Continue reading...
items.content: Militant group confirms Haytham Ali Tabatabai was killed in attack that dramatically escalates tensions in the regionIsrael targeted one of Hezbollah’s most senior military commanders in an airstrike in Beirut’s southern suburbs on Sunday, dramatically escalating tensions with the group almost exactly a year after a ceasefire ended 14 months of clashes.The Israeli military said several hours after the attack that Haytham Ali Tabatabai, Hezbollah’s chief of staff, was killed in the strike in Lebanese capital. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Israel has escalated its campaign on targets it says are linked to Hezbollah, raising fears of a resumption of hostilities.
items.content: Israel has escalated its campaign on targets it says are linked to Hezbollah, raising fears of a resumption of hostilities.

items.title: Israel attacks Beirut suburb two days after Lebanon agreed for talks
items.standfirst: Israel kills top Hezbollah commander only two days after Lebanon's president said he was open to negotiations.
items.content: Israel kills top Hezbollah commander only two days after Lebanon's president said he was open to negotiations.

items.title: Israel: Hezbollah chief of staff killed in Beirut strike
items.standfirst: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said on Sunday that Hezbollah's chief of staff Haytham Ali Tabatabai was killed in an airstrike on Israel conducted on Beirut earlier in the day."Tabatabai led Hezbolla...
items.content: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said on Sunday that Hezbollah's chief of staff Haytham Ali Tabatabai was killed in an airstrike on Israel conducted on Beirut earlier in the day."Tabatabai led Hezbolla...

items.title: 'Haytham Ali Tabtabai had been wanted by both the US and Israel for years'
items.standfirst: Israel killed militant group Hezbollah's top military official in an airstrike on a southern suburb of Beirut on Sunday, the Israeli military said, despite a US-brokered truce a year ago. "Haytham Ali Tabtabai had been wanted by both the US and Israel for years," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Beirut, Lebanon, Rawad Taha.
items.content: Israel killed militant group Hezbollah's top military official in an airstrike on a southern suburb of Beirut on Sunday, the Israeli military said, despite a US-brokered truce a year ago. "Haytham Ali Tabtabai had been wanted by both the US and Israel for years," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Beirut, Lebanon, Rawad Taha.

items.title: Israel kills a senior Hezbollah official in Beirut strike
items.standfirst: Israel killed Hezbollah's chief of staff in an air strike on the southern suburbs of Beirut, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Sunday. Lebanese officials said the air strike killed at least five people and wounded 28 more.
items.content: Israel killed Hezbollah's chief of staff in an air strike on the southern suburbs of Beirut, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Sunday. Lebanese officials said the air strike killed at least five people and wounded 28 more.

items.title: Israel says it killed a senior Hezbollah official in first strike on Beirut in months

items.content: Hezbollah confirms death of 'great commander' Haytham Ali Tabatabai, says attacks 'open door to escalation of assaults'.

The attack occurred in Beirut's southern suburbs on Sunday.
Hezbollah confirmed the death of Haytham Ali Tabatabai.
The Israeli military stated Tabatabai was killed in the strike.
The attack escalated tensions in the region.

clusters.title: US ‘very optimistic’ Ukraine peace plan can be reached ‘very soon’: Rubio
clusters.neutral_headline: US and Ukraine Discuss Peace Plan in Geneva

items.title: US ‘very optimistic’ Ukraine peace plan can be reached ‘very soon’: Rubio
items.standfirst: Rubio says 'tremendous' progress made in meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on proposal to halt the war.
items.content: Rubio says 'tremendous' progress made in meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on proposal to halt the war.

items.title: 'The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan'
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio boasted "tremendous" progress after a day of meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Geneva on a proposal to halt the Ukraine war, but numerous uncertainties remain. "The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan, nor did Rubio [ . . .] Clearly the Ukrainians are in a very difficult position," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Kyiv, Ukraine Gulliver Cragg.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio boasted "tremendous" progress after a day of meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Geneva on a proposal to halt the Ukraine war, but numerous uncertainties remain. "The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan, nor did Rubio [ . . .] Clearly the Ukrainians are in a very difficult position," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Kyiv, Ukraine Gulliver Cragg.

items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio described the first session of high-stakes talks in Geneva as "probably the most productive and meaningful meeting" since the start of the second Trump administration.

items.standfirst: Top Ukrainian envoys met with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Geneva Sunday to discuss President Donald Trump’s proposal to end Russia’s war on Ukraine.
items.content: Top Ukrainian envoys met with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Geneva Sunday to discuss President Donald Trump’s proposal to end Russia’s war on Ukraine.

items.content: US, European and Ukrainian representatives meet in Geneva to discuss 28-point plan to end war with Russia

items.title: Zelensky thanks Trump as US leader accuses Ukraine of showing 'zero gratitude'
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky sought to win back US President Donald Trump's favour on Sunday, after the US leader slammed Kyiv amid crucial talks in Geneva to end the war with Russia.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky sought to win back US President Donald Trump's favour on Sunday, after the US leader slammed Kyiv amid crucial talks in Geneva to end the war with Russia.

items.title: US, Ukrainian and European officials meet in Geneva for talks on peace plan
items.standfirst: Officials from the United States, Ukraine, and national security advisers from France, the United Kingdom and Germany are meeting in Geneva today to review Washington’s draft proposal to end the war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, Russia claims a major heat and power plant in the Moscow region was struck in a drone attack. Director of the Eurasia Democracy Initiative based in Kyiv, Ukraine, Peter Zalmayev, joins us for more insights.
items.content: Officials from the United States, Ukraine, and national security advisers from France, the United Kingdom and Germany are meeting in Geneva today to review Washington’s draft proposal to end the war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, Russia claims a major heat and power plant in the Moscow region was struck in a drone attack. Director of the Eurasia Democracy Initiative based in Kyiv, Ukraine, Peter Zalmayev, joins us for more insights.

items.title: Allies meet in Geneva to rework US plan on Ukraine-Russia war
items.standfirst: Senior officials from the United States, Ukraine, and national security advisers from France, the UK and Germany are meeting in Geneva on Sunday to discuss Washington’s draft proposal to end the war in Ukraine. As Russia’s invasion enters its fourth year, the Ukrainian side and its European partners are pushing to significantly rewrite Donald Trump’s peace plan, which critics argue amounts to a capitulation to Moscow. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.
items.content: Senior officials from the United States, Ukraine, and national security advisers from France, the UK and Germany are meeting in Geneva on Sunday to discuss Washington’s draft proposal to end the war in Ukraine. As Russia’s invasion enters its fourth year, the Ukrainian side and its European partners are pushing to significantly rewrite Donald Trump’s peace plan, which critics argue amounts to a capitulation to Moscow. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.

items.title: US-Ukraine talks: Why are European leaders opposing Trump’s peace plan?
items.standfirst: Officials from the US, EU and Ukraine meet in Geneva to discuss Donald Trump's plan to end Russia's war with Ukraine.
items.content: Officials from the US, EU and Ukraine meet in Geneva to discuss Donald Trump's plan to end Russia's war with Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine-Russia peace talks under way as US insists it authored peace plan
items.standfirst: Fresh talks on the future of the war in Ukraine are underway in Geneva, with delegations from the US, Ukraine, and European allies participating. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that “diplomacy has been activated” and expressed hope that the meetings would be constructive. The talks follow criticism from Western leaders of a 28-point peace plan promoted by US President Donald Trump, widely seen as favouring Russia. France24 correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports the latest from Kyiv, Ukraine.
items.content: Fresh talks on the future of the war in Ukraine are underway in Geneva, with delegations from the US, Ukraine, and European allies participating. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that “diplomacy has been activated” and expressed hope that the meetings would be constructive. The talks follow criticism from Western leaders of a 28-point peace plan promoted by US President Donald Trump, widely seen as favouring Russia. France24 correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports the latest from Kyiv, Ukraine.

items.title: U.S. and Ukraine hold talks as lawmakers and allies voice concern over Russian 'wish list'
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has landed in Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European leaders on Sunday.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has landed in Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European leaders on Sunday.

ai_summary: US and Ukrainian officials met in Geneva to discuss a peace plan.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio described the talks as productive.
Donald Trump's proposal aims to halt the war in Ukraine.
Ukraine has not specified changes to the peace plan.
The EU is seeking a role in the ongoing negotiations.

clusters.title: Bolsonaro says ankle monitor damage caused by paranoia
clusters.neutral_headline: Bolsonaro Claims Medication Caused Ankle Monitor Tampering

items.title: Bolsonaro says ankle monitor damage caused by paranoia
items.standfirst: Brazil's convicted ex-president blames medication for tempering with his monitor under house arrest.
items.content: Brazil's convicted ex-president blames medication for tempering with his monitor under house arrest.

items.title: Bolsonaro says hallucinatory effects of meds made him tamper with ankle tag
items.standfirst: Brazil's ex-president, convicted of foiled coup, is under arrest after taking a soldering iron to the monitoring device.
items.content: Brazil's ex-president, convicted of foiled coup, is under arrest after taking a soldering iron to the monitoring device.

items.title: Bolsonaro says ‘hallucinations’ led him to violate ankle monitor, causing his arrest
items.standfirst: On his first full day in jail, former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro told a judge on Sunday he had violated his ankle monitoring the day before at his house arrest because of a nervous breakdown and hallucinations caused by a change in his medication.
items.content: On his first full day in jail, former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro told a judge on Sunday he had violated his ankle monitoring the day before at his house arrest because of a nervous breakdown and hallucinations caused by a change in his medication.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro claims ‘psychotic attack’ made him tamper with ankle monitor
items.standfirst: Brazil’s former president says he took a soldering iron to electronic tag as he was hallucinating that it was buggedBrazil’s far-right former president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he took a soldering iron to his electronic ankle monitor after having a substance-induced “psychotic attack” that caused him to hallucinate that the device was bugged.Bolsonaro made the claim during a custody hearing on Sunday, 24 hours after he was arrested at his home in the capital, Brasília, amid suspicions he was planning to abscond to a foreign embassy to avoid being sent to jail to serve a 27-year sentence for masterminding a failed coup. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazil’s former president says he took a soldering iron to electronic tag as he was hallucinating that it was buggedBrazil’s far-right former president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he took a soldering iron to his electronic ankle monitor after having a substance-induced “psychotic attack” that caused him to hallucinate that the device was bugged.Bolsonaro made the claim during a custody hearing on Sunday, 24 hours after he was arrested at his home in the capital, Brasília, amid suspicions he was planning to abscond to a foreign embassy to avoid being sent to jail to serve a 27-year sentence for masterminding a failed coup. Continue reading...

items.title: How the arrest of former president Jair Bolsonaro has divided Brazilians
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into police custody after tampering with his ankle monitor.
items.content: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into police custody after tampering with his ankle monitor.

items.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro arrested over flight risk after tampering with his ankle monitor
items.standfirst: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal custody on Saturday over suspicion he would try to evade his 27-year prison sentence. The arrest, ordered by the Supreme Court, came after Bolsonaro allegedly tampered with his ankle monitor, prompting fears he might flee amid demonstrations organised by his family.
items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal custody on Saturday over suspicion he would try to evade his 27-year prison sentence. The arrest, ordered by the Supreme Court, came after Bolsonaro allegedly tampered with his ankle monitor, prompting fears he might flee amid demonstrations organised by his family.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after tampering with ankle tag ‘out of curiosity’
items.standfirst: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Former Brazilian President Bolsonaro was arrested for tampering with his ankle monitor.
Bolsonaro claimed medication caused hallucinations leading to the violation.
He stated he had a "psychotic attack" and thought the device was bugged.
The arrest occurred after he was suspected of planning to flee.
Bolsonaro is facing a 27-year sentence for a failed coup.

clusters.title: Mamdani says meeting with President Trump was "productive"
clusters.neutral_headline: Mamdani Stands by Trump Criticism After Meeting

items.title: Mamdani says meeting with President Trump was "productive"
items.standfirst: NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani is back in the city following his unexpectedly friendly meeting with President Trump at the White House.
items.content: NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani is back in the city following his unexpectedly friendly meeting with President Trump at the White House.

items.title: Mamdani maintains Trump a ‘fascist’ despite cordial White House meeting
items.standfirst: The incoming NYC mayor says he still believes the US president is a fascist, two days after they had a friendly meeting.
items.content: The incoming NYC mayor says he still believes the US president is a fascist, two days after they had a friendly meeting.

items.title: Mamdani reiterates Trump is a ‘fascist’ just days after cordial meeting
items.standfirst: New York mayor-elect reaffirms past criticisms of president after agreeing to work with him on cost-of-living concernsZohran Mamdani has reiterated his view that Donald Trump is a “fascist” and a “despot” just days after the pair had a surprisingly cordial meeting at the White House.Speaking to NBC’s Meet the Press on Sunday, the New York City mayor-elect was asked if he still considered Trump a threat to democracy. “Everything that I’ve said in the past I continue to believe,” Mamdani replied. “I think it is important in our politics that we don’t shy away from where we have disagreements.” Continue reading...
items.content: New York mayor-elect reaffirms past criticisms of president after agreeing to work with him on cost-of-living concernsZohran Mamdani has reiterated his view that Donald Trump is a “fascist” and a “despot” just days after the pair had a surprisingly cordial meeting at the White House.Speaking to NBC’s Meet the Press on Sunday, the New York City mayor-elect was asked if he still considered Trump a threat to democracy. “Everything that I’ve said in the past I continue to believe,” Mamdani replied. “I think it is important in our politics that we don’t shy away from where we have disagreements.” Continue reading...

items.title: Mamdani stands by his criticisms of Trump despite friendly White House meeting
items.standfirst: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani didn't back down in an interview that aired Sunday from past criticism that President Donald Trump acted like a despot and a fascist after a surprisingly friendly White House meeting between the two men.
items.content: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani didn't back down in an interview that aired Sunday from past criticism that President Donald Trump acted like a despot and a fascist after a surprisingly friendly White House meeting between the two men.

ai_summary: NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani met with President Trump.
Mamdani still considers Trump a fascist despite the meeting.
He reiterated his past criticisms of Trump.
The meeting was surprisingly cordial.
Mamdani stated he stands by his disagreements.

items.title: Ukrainian refugee Danylo Yavhusishyn wows Japan to win his country’s first elite sumo title
items.standfirst: 21-year-old beats grand champion HoshoryuWrestler uses ring name Aonishiki ArataDanylo Yavhusishyn has become the first Ukrainian to win a sumo tournament in Japan.The 21-year-old, who fled the war in Ukraine three years ago, won the Kyushu tournament after a tie-breaking victory over grand champion Hoshoryu from Mongolia. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.content: Ukraine-born wrestler Aonishiki Arata is the first from his country to win an elite-level sumo championship in Japan.

He won the Kyushu tournament.

clusters.title: In full: Europe's 28-point counter proposal to US-Russia peace plan for Ukraine

clusters.title: Slovenians reject assisted-dying law in national referendum

items.title: Slovenians reject assisted-dying law in national referendum
items.standfirst: Slovenians voted on Sunday to suspend a new law legalising assisted dying after opponents forced a referendum. With nearly all ballots counted, about 53% rejected the measure and 47% backed it, delaying its implementation for at least a year, election authorities said.
items.content: Slovenians voted on Sunday to suspend a new law legalising assisted dying after opponents forced a referendum. With nearly all ballots counted, about 53% rejected the measure and 47% backed it, delaying its implementation for at least a year, election authorities said.

Around 53 percent of voters had rejected the law, while 47 percent voted in favour, meaning its implementation will be suspended for at least…

Around 53 percent of voters had rejected the law, while 47 percent voted in favour, meaning its implementation will be suspended for at least…

items.title: ‘That doesn’t exist’: Doge reportedly quietly disbanded ahead of schedule
items.standfirst: Statement by Trump administration confirms longstanding suspicions that Musk-led agency is on its way outThe “department of government efficiency” (Doge) has apparently been dissolved with eight months still remaining on its contract, ending a drawn-out campaign of invading federal agencies and firing thousands of federal workers.“That doesn’t exist,” office of personnel management (OPM) director Scott Kupor told Reuters earlier this month when asked about Doge’s status, adding that it was no longer a “centralized entity”. Continue reading...
items.content: Statement by Trump administration confirms longstanding suspicions that Musk-led agency is on its way outThe “department of government efficiency” (Doge) has apparently been dissolved with eight months still remaining on its contract, ending a drawn-out campaign of invading federal agencies and firing thousands of federal workers.“That doesn’t exist,” office of personnel management (OPM) director Scott Kupor told Reuters earlier this month when asked about Doge’s status, adding that it was no longer a “centralized entity”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has reportedly been dissolved.
DOGE was led by Elon Musk.

DOGE was a campaign of invading federal agencies.

items.title: Main opposition barred in Guinea-Bissau vote as President Embalo seeks second term
items.standfirst: Bissau-Guineans head to the polls on Sunday for presidential and parliamentary elections. President Umaro Sissoco Embalo, a 53-year-old former army general seeking a second term, is backed by a political coalition of more than 20 groups, but the main opposition party has been barred from running.
